snippet.title: 'Her face bounced into the ground': Toddler in hospital after trams collide on Bourke St
snippet.content:
Four people, including a child, have been taken to hospital after two trams collided on Bourke Street. Ambulance Victoria said a pre-school aged child was taken to the Royal Children's Hospital.Photo: Steffanie Tan Two other people were taken to Royal Melbourne Hospital and one to The Alfred. All four were in a stable condition. The collision happened near the intersection with Spencer Street, opposite Southern Cross station on Wednesday afternoon. An 86 tram rear-ended a 96 tram.
Ambulance Victoria say they assessed about 15 people with six being treated for minor injuries. Hanqi Liu was on the tram when it crashed and was shocked when a toddler was knocked to the ground. "Her face bounced into the ground and her nose started bleeding," Ms Liu said. "The mother said call an ambulance, a lot of people bumped themselves in the face. "I don't know what happened, it's on a tram, it's supposed to be safe." The 96 and 86 trams are being diverted, with the section of Bourke Street, between Spencer and King, having been closed by police.
More to come
